column4: I have a pendrive in a computer, but I can't seem to mount it :(  lsusb shows "Bus 005 Device 003: ID 03f0:3217 Hewlett-Packard"  what can I do to fix this.
does it appear in sudo fdisk -l ?
it doesn't seem to only /dev/sda etc. (HDD)
unplug it and replug it in and then pastebin the output of dmesg
I can't... I am not physically at the computer.  Connected via ssh and vncviewer.
err right. then how did you plug said thumbdrive in?
someone else did.
okay, can I have your dmesg output anyway please (and also you're sure they plugged it in?)
its plugged in it show in the 'Places' menu.
here is the /var/log/dmesg file
do you still want to look at the /var/log/dmesg
please pastebin the output of sudo fdisk -l
http://paste.ubuntu.com/250599/
and this was with the flash drive plugged in?
yes... according to lsusb
hmm, does the flash drive work on other computers/OS's?
yes.. Widows, it has a file that is wanted.
well its most odd as fdisk does not detect and flash drives. Could unplug and replug the flash drive and pastebin the output of dmesg upon doing so
this appears to be section you want. http://paste.ubuntu.com/250602/
hmm it really doesn't like that flash drive. I would check to make sure its still working, and reformat it
running version 2.6.24-24-generic of the kernel.... downloading update now.
